intro: Galium helodes var. asperrimum, commonly known as rough wood-sorrel, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems and opposite, heart-shaped leaves that are covered in fine, stiff hairs. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its hairy leaves and stems give it a distinctive, rugged appearance.
